intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. morierei, commonly known as the Moriere's beautiful centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
